previewPlan.name: Isolation base x-Training Intermediate Strength - Beginner Yoga - MTP

prospects.name: Total Newbie Yoga
prospects.description: Yoga-curious but don't know where to start? This session is a great place to dip your toes in. This easy, basic routine will introduce you to some simple foundational moves while giving you a little stretch and some light strength work at the same time. Think of it as the gateway drug to bringing yoga into your life.

prospects.name: 02. Identifying Your Personal Big Mountain
prospects.description:
What - exactly - are you trying to accomplish? When you're ready to answer that question, this module will help you gain clarity on who you are as an athlete and identify your major goal—your Personal Big Mountain.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[The Importance of SMART Goal Setting](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/start-now-goal-setting-basics)' and '[How to use your personal outlook to set more effective goals](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/know-thyself-how-to-use-your-personal-outlook-to-set-more-effective-goals)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science.
prospects.notes: With most races and events canceled or postponed, it’s likely that the goals you set at the beginning of the year have been impacted. There’s never a better time to delve into the Mental Toughness Programme. Seeing challenges as opportunities is one of the key habits of the mentally strong. Use these 4 weeks as an opportunity to set new goals and improve aspects of your physical and mental fitness that otherwise you might have neglected. Go all in now so you can go all out later.

prospects.name: Full Body 03
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

In this session, we begin adding variations to the foundational moves you’ve mastered so far (you’ve mastered them, right?). This will keep challenging you, as will the increases in duration of a few sets -- such as the squats -- so you can complete a few more reps.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Forward Lunge
- Lateral Lunge with Extended Hands
- Hip Hinge
- Single-Leg Squat with Opposite Reach
- Squat with Wide Stance
- Hip Bridge
- Frog Crunch
- Push-Up On Knees
- Back Extension with Reps
- Quadruped with Arm Raise
- Plank
- Plank with Leg Lifts
- Side Plank
- Side Plank with Leg Raise
- Side Plank with Pulsing Hand

prospects.name: Morning Yoga Routine
prospects.description: In this sequence, we start with a short breathing exercise to relax the body and calm the mind, then mobilize joints throughout the body. From there we move into deeper stretches for the hips and hamstrings and finish with a short meditation.

prospects.name: 04. Getting Positive
prospects.description:
Thoughts matter. To accomplish big goals you need the ability to maintain a positive mindset, regardless of what life gives you. Here's an overview of the power of maintaining a positive mindset. We’ll introduce specific techniques that will help you identify negative thoughts, see obstacles as opportunities, and take a more positive path forward.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.
prospects.notes: Overview of the power of a positive mindset. We’ll introduce specific tools to help you identify negative thoughts, stop them and take a more positive path forward.

prospects.name: Full Body 05
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

In this routine, we’re going to throw in a few moves you haven’t seen yet to complete the foundational moves in the Full Body series. You’ll also find some new, subtle variations to the exercises you know well. While the differences seem small, the unique demands will speed up your adaptation phase.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- Hip Bridge
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Reverse Lunge with Hands Over Head
- Backward Lunge
- Lateral Lunge with Same Hand
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Hip Hinge with Opposite Reach
- Single-Leg Squat with Hands Forward
- Goblet Squat
- Push-Up On Knees
- Back Extension
- Back Extension with Reps
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Plank with Alternate Arm Reach
- Plank with Leg Lifts
- Side Plank with Hip Raise
- Side Plank with Hip Drop
- High Side Plank
- Half Twists

prospects.name: Basic Yoga Poses
prospects.description: Throughout the SYSTM yoga program there are several basic, foundational moves that form the core of the routines. This session takes you through those moves in detail so you can master them and their more difficult variations.

prospects.name: 06. Relaxing to Recover
prospects.description:
Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Super Easy Stretch Routine I
prospects.description: Are you looking for a simple stretching routine you can do on a regular basis? New to yoga? Designed for yoga beginners, this gentle yoga session will get you on the road to a more flexible you. You've said for years you'd start stretching. Now's your chance.

prospects.name: End Of Day Stretch
prospects.description:
This slow and stretchy sequence is ideal for practicing at the end of a long day at work or after travel. It focuses on opening up the chest and shoulders, stretching the neck and forearms, and releasing tension in the calves, hamstrings, hips, and lower back. These poses can also be used after a workout for a comprehensive full-body stretch.

​

The objectives are to stretch the neck, shoulders, triceps, chest, and forearms; release tension in the lower back, hips, hamstrings, calves, ankles, and feet; transition the body into parasympathetic "rest or digest" mode after exercise; and help alleviate lower and mid back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Puppy
- Screaming Toe
- Neck Stretch
- Ankle Stretch
- Chest Stretch
- Forearm Stretch
- Downward Dog
- Revolved Standing Forward Bend
- Low Lunge Chest Opener
- Dead Pigeon
- Reclining Spinal Twist

prospects.name: 07. Positive Self-Talk
prospects.description:
Improve your confidence and performance through three types of positive self-talk: Motivational, Instructional, and Reward. Here, we’ll look at the subtle and not-so-subtle effects that words have on our attitude and performance. You’ll listen more closely to the way you talk to yourself so you can improve that internal dialogue and become your own biggest fan.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[The Power of Positive Mental Strategies](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/episode-29-how-to-use-positive-self-talk-to-get-through-tough-moments-on-a-ride-mental-strategies)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Fitness.

prospects.name: Improving Posture
prospects.description: Most cyclists suffer from rounded shoulders and a curved spine as a result of hours spent in the riding position. This series will release tension in your upper back and get you standing up straight and powerful again.

prospects.name: 08. Improving Focus
prospects.description:
Develop an understanding of why focused concentration is so important to your performance. We will delve into what it means to be in “The Zone," look at the psychology and the physiology of peak performance, and what it takes to get there.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Mobilize Your Body
prospects.description:
In this video, we focus on mobilizing the wrists, elbows, shoulders, neck, spine, hips, ankles, and toes to enhance overall mobility throughout the body. It is an excellent routine to practice in the morning or evening to alleviate stiffness.

​

The objectives are to increase mobility in the wrists, elbows, shoulders, neck, spine, hips, and ankles.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Screaming Toe
- Wrist Circles
- Elbow Circles
- Shoulder Circles
- Neck Circles
- Thunderbolt
- Kneeling Cat-Cow
- Thoracic Spine Circles
- Seated Twists
- Hip Circles
- Squat Twists
- Standing Forward Bends
- Reclining Hip Circles
- Windscreen Wipers
- Ankle Mobilisations
- Knees-To-Chest

prospects.name: Recovery Session A
prospects.description:
These recovery sessions are easy enough that you get the rest you need, but work you hard enough that your body continues to adapt to the new demands you place on it. You might see these sessions as too short and too easy to be beneficial, but just like a proper recovery spin, active recovery is infinitely better than doing nothing at all. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend also doing a Yoga Session in the app first. Something like Mobilize and Activate, Balance and Agility, or Full Body Mobilization.

​

**Exercises Included**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands to Side
- High Plank
- Plank
- Hip Bridge
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands to Side

prospects.name: Morning Yoga Routine
prospects.description: In this sequence, we start with a short breathing exercise to relax the body and calm the mind, then mobilize joints throughout the body. From there we move into deeper stretches for the hips and hamstrings and finish with a short meditation.

prospects.name: 09. Focus Exercise
prospects.description:
Improve your ability to push away distractions and focus on the task at hand. This five-minute exercise will get you primed and ready to unleash your power from within. That means you should be in your kit and ready to train as soon as you complete this exercise.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Supple Spine & Hips
prospects.description:
This classic yoga sequence enhances mobility in the spine and hips while stretching the calves, hamstrings, hip flexors, and lower back. As you become familiar with the routine, you can begin to focus on synchronizing your breath with your movements, aiming to use nasal breathing as much as possible. It is an excellent practice for the morning to warm up and improve focus, or it can be done directly after a workout to help prevent extreme muscle stiffness.

​

The objectives are to improve mobility in the spine and hips, stretch the calves, hamstrings, hip flexors, and lower back, practice synchronizing breath and movement, and potentially alleviate lower back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Mountain
- Half Sun Salutations
- Downward Dog
- Crescent Lunge
- Bridge
- Reclining Spinal Twist
- Final Resting Pose

prospects.name: 13. Kicking Ass in your Sleep Part I
prospects.description:
Pre-sleep visualization is a tool that helps build confidence and willpower. This module includes an exercise to detail what it will feel like to stand on the summit of your Big Mountain.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 17. Overcoming Obstacles
prospects.description:
Rainbows? Puppy dogs? Not always. Sometimes things go wrong and this session will get you moving again. As a visualization exercise, this module is meant to be listened to whenever you feel stuck—whether that’s due to an obstacle you can’t see a way around, an injury, a loss of motivation, or any other reason which makes you doubt yourself. Even if you don’t have an obstacle right now, it’s a good idea to go through the module so you know what it’s about and when to use it. It will help you re-focus, reset, and reestablish your confidence in who you are and where you’re headed.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Yoga for Travel
prospects.description: If you're traveling and will be off your bike for some time, you might feel that all is lost. But we've created a routine for travelers to keep you balanced, loose, and strong. Do this daily while on the road so you'll be in top condition when you can get back home.

prospects.name: Recovery Session B
prospects.description:
This session is designed to keep your body familiar with the basic movements of strength training without adding any extra fatigue to your system. This keeps your body adapted while allowing it to fully recover. To make the most out of your strength gains, you need to balance the hard work with adequate recovery. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend completing a supplementary Yoga Session after this video. Something like Improving Posture, Shake Off the Day or Recovery Booster would be perfect.

​

**Exercises Included**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- High Plank to Pigeon Pose
- Plank with Leg Lifts
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Fast Lateral Lunges with Knees Up
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Side to Side

prospects.name: Loosen Neck and Shoulders
prospects.description: Cycling can put a lot of strain on your neck and shoulders, especially if you spend a lot of time down in the drops or in an aero position. This session will help loosen your neck and shoulders with a series of exercises that will release tension and have you feeling relaxed and ready to hit it again.

prospects.name: Hips and Hamstrings
prospects.description: This routine is designed to open up the hips—the hip flexors, rotators, and glutes—and stretch the hamstrings. The session guides you through a series of lunges and finishes with Lizard and Pigeon pose. You can practice it in the morning, before or after a ride. Experiment to see what works best for you.

These poses can also be used after a workout for a comprehensive full-body stretch.

The objectives are to stretch the neck, shoulders, triceps, chest, and forearms; release tension in the lower back, hips, hamstrings, calves, ankles, and feet; transition the body into parasympathetic "rest or digest" mode after exercise; and help alleviate lower and mid back pain.

prospects.name: 12. Workout Review
prospects.description:
We’re going to take the techniques you've learned during the “Monthly Review and Improve“ module, and apply them to your training sessions. This module should be completed immediately after finishing a workout. Have your workbook with you so after the cool-down you can start the workout review exercise immediately.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Upper Body Strength
prospects.description: Those things you use to type and lift up your coffee cup? Yeah, those could be a bit stronger. So it's time to build strength in your upper body—in the hands, wrists, arms, shoulders, chest, and core. It is based around Sun Salutation, a yoga sequence that builds strength, increases power, and improves endurance.

prospects.name: Lower Back Release
prospects.description:
This video is designed to alleviate tightness in the lower back by releasing tension in the lower back, glutes, piriformis, groin, hamstrings, and calves through a series of reclining hip-opening poses combined with deep, diaphragmatic breathing.

​

The objectives are to stretch the lower back, glutes, piriformis, groin, hamstrings, and calves, improve mobility in the hips and spine, and help alleviate lower back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Wind-Relieving
- Reclining Spinal Twist
- Knees-To-Chest
- Reclining Hand-To-Big-Toe
- Dead Pigeon
- Happy Baby

prospects.name: 13. Kicking Ass in your Sleep Part I
prospects.description:
Pre-sleep visualization is a tool that helps build confidence and willpower. This module includes an exercise to detail what it will feel like to stand on the summit of your Big Mountain.

Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Full Body 07
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

At this point, you’ve mastered the form and balance demands of the basic foundational moves. We’re kicking the duration and intensity up a notch here. Variations on these exercises will become more and more difficult and any bad habits will become amplified - so keep paying attention to getting that form right under this increased workload.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Fast Lateral Lunges with Knees Up
- Forward Lunge with Shoulder Press
- Forward Lunge
- Hip Hinge
- Hip Hinge with Row
- Lateral Lunge with Opposite Hand
- Lateral Lunge with Opposite Hand + Shoulder Press
- Single-Leg Squat with Hands Forward
- Squat with Wide Stance
- Goblet Squat with Split Stance
- Push-Up On Knees
- High Plank with Leg Lifts
- High Plank with Arm Raise
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Quadruped with Arm Raise
- Back Extension with Arm Arcs
- Side Plank with Reps + Leg Raise
- Side Plank with Toe Touches
- High Side Plank
- Bicycle Crunch
- Frog Crunch
- Hip Bridge with Hands in Air

prospects.name: The One For Your Hips
prospects.description:
This classic yoga sequence is designed to enhance hip mobility by stretching the hip flexors, glutes, groin, hamstrings, and calves through a series of static poses. The routine emphasizes releasing tension with each exhalation. It is particularly effective for alleviating lower back pain and improving hip range of motion. This sequence can be practiced at any time of day.

​

The objectives are to improve hip mobility, stretch the hip flexors, glutes, groin, hamstrings, and calves, practice nasal breathing with movement, and potentially alleviate lower back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Mountain
- Low Lunge
- Downward Dog Split
- Lizard
- Pigeon
- Happy Baby
- Final Resting Pose

prospects.name: 09. Focus Exercise
prospects.description:
Improve your ability to push away distractions and focus on the task at hand. This five-minute exercise will get you primed and ready to unleash your power from within. That means you should be in your kit and ready to train as soon as you complete this exercise.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Full Body 09
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This session has a greater focus on your upper body and core work to truly integrate your strength training. These additional exercises ensure that you distribute loads and tension throughout your body, helping you become the most well-rounded athlete you can be. Take your time and focus on perfect form as these moves are still rather new to your nervous system.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Hands in Air + Reps
- Reverse Lunge with Hands to Side
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Single-Leg Dip with Opposite Reach
- Single-Leg Dip with Reach
- Goblet Squat
- Squat with Knee Raises
- Backward Lunge
- Backward Lunge with Shoulder Press
- Hip Hinge with Shoulder Press
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Lateral Lunge with Extended Hands
- Push-Up with Wide Hands
- High Plank with Leg Lifts
- High Plank with Knee to Chest
- Back Extension with Reps
- Quadruped with Arm Raise
- Hip Bridge with Hands in Air + Reps
- Half Twists
- Side Plank
- Side Plank with Underneath Reach
- High Side Plank with Hip Raise
- High Side Plank with Hip Drop

prospects.name: Peak Pose Wheel
prospects.description:
This sequence builds towards the advanced backbend, Wheel pose. To prepare for this pose, the routine focuses on mobilizing the spine and shoulders and opening up the fronts of the hips. It is best practiced when fully warmed up, with careful attention to the lower back and only moving within safe ranges of motion. For those who can practice Wheel safely, it serves as an excellent counterpose to common postures from cycling or sitting at a desk, potentially alleviating lower back, upper back, and shoulder pain. For those not yet ready for Wheel, the other poses in this sequence are also effective for addressing muscular imbalances.

​

The objectives are to increase spinal and shoulder mobility, stretch the abs, chest, and fronts of the shoulders, open up the hip flexors, activate the glutes, and help alleviate lower and upper back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Supported Bridge
- Thunderbolt—Shoulder Rolls
- Kneeling Cat-Cow
- Puppy
- Downward Facing Dog
- Cobra
- Low Lunge with Shoulder Opener
- Bridge
- Wheel
- Windscreen Wipers

prospects.name: Full Body 07
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

At this point, you’ve mastered the form and balance demands of the basic foundational moves. We’re kicking the duration and intensity up a notch here. Variations on these exercises will become more and more difficult and any bad habits will become amplified - so keep paying attention to getting that form right under this increased workload.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hips Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Fast Lateral Lunges with Knees Up
- Forward Lunge with Shoulder Press
- Forward Lunge
- Hip Hinge
- Hip Hinge with Row
- Lateral Lunge with Opposite Hand
- Lateral Lunge with Opposite Hand + Shoulder Press
- Single-Leg Squat with Hands Forward
- Squat with Wide Stance
- Goblet Squat with Split Stance
- Push-Up On Knees
- High Plank with Leg Lifts
- High Plank with Arm Raise
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Quadruped with Arm Raise
- Back Extension with Arm Arcs
- Side Plank with Reps + Leg Raise
- Side Plank with Toe Touches
- High Side Plank
- Bicycle Crunch
- Frog Crunch
- Hip Bridge with Hands in Air

prospects.name: 15. Kicking Ass in your Sleep Part II
prospects.description:
This visualization exercise is designed to be completed when you’re in bed, ready to fall asleep. You’ll travel from your bedroom to the summit of your Big Mountain.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Recovery Booster
prospects.description: It may seem counterintuitive, but it's during recovery when you actually get stronger and consolidate the gains you've made while training. Without proper recovery, you won't improve. This session helps boost your recovery time, relaxing you and ensuring you give your body the chance to grow stronger.

prospects.name: MTP - 1st Month Review & Improve
prospects.description: REVIEW & IMPROVE:A look back at the past month to see what was done well and what could be better. Set a new goal for the month ahead and learn how to keep an eye on your ‘fundamentals’ (e.g., sleep, hydration, etc.).
